subject: CES 2026 Recap: Five Trends Shaping the Future of Tech
content:
Qualcomm Vision

By Qualcomm


By Qualcomm

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ces-2026-recap-five-trends-shaping-future-tech-qualcomm-jbx1c?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BdRZUR9GAT2O4iYRd1pCpzA%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=2Jkf_0NZoVEc41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-kzybj4~mk7i1nkz~ns-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk7i1nkz-ns&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGVmYjQ4ZmNlZDk0MDliYTg4YzZhN2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NjBjM2QzODkwNDgyZmM5MGI1YTI1OTZiMDE3N2U5NjhmOTU5NzI1ZDczZDliZTA1LDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
CES 2026 CES 2026 was a turning point: artificial intelligence is now powering real products across every category. With physical AI emerging as the next big wave of industrialized tech and personal AI experiences redefining mobile platforms, this week proved that execution, not hype, is the new benchmark. ¬† Here are the five trends that defined the show and what they mean for Qualcomm‚Äôs vision of the future.¬† Robots are ready for prime time¬† For decades, robotics exhibits were characterized by controlled experiments rather than scalable solutions. That changed during CES 2026. Qualcomm‚Äôs introduction of the Qualcomm Dragonwing IQ10 Series drew attention for enabling machines that can see, reason, and act. Humanoids and autonomous mobile robots showcased capabilities that go beyond scripted moves, thanks to integrated AI models running on efficient edge compute. ¬† At the Qualcomm booth, this evolution was on full display. VinMotion‚Äôs Motion 2 humanoid, powered by the Dragonwing IQ9 Series, demonstrated fluid movement, adaptive intelligence and language capabilities by greeting and waving to guests. Qualcomm also featured Advantech‚Äôs robotics development kit, designed for rapid, multi-application deployment. And APLUX brought a Booster Robot to show off its dance and kung fu skills at the Qualcomm booth, showing agility and adaptability.¬† The takeaway? Robotics are moving from concept to reality, faster than you think.¬† APLUX Booster Robot AI PCs become the default¬† The introduction of Snapdragon X Series processors was a major inflection point in the transformation of personal computers. With built-in AI capabilities, the user experience started to move from rigid commands and workflows to devices that adapt to us.¬†¬† The new Snapdragon X2 Plus exemplifies this evolution: with cutting-edge NPU performance and multi-day battery life, it brings sophisticated AI capabilities to everyday laptops. The result is a PC that doesn‚Äôt just respond but predicts, learns, and optimizes in real time.¬† During the Future of Computing: Shaping the Next Era of AI PCs, Kedar Kondap, Qualcomm‚Äôs SVP & GM, Compute and Gaming, outlined how this shift will occur: ‚ÄúThe PC that we know today is going to evolve in a dramatic way. The definition of PC as a personal computer is going to change over time. ¬† ‚ÄúFor the last 10‚Äì15 years, we were all trying to learn how to use a PC, different commands, different workflows. I think that interaction is going to flip. The PC is going to start to understand the user a lot more in this new agentic world. It's going to know the kinds of things you want to do. It's going to take a few steps ahead and think about what you want to do next.‚Äù¬† Snapdragon X2 Plus processor Cars enter the AI defined era¬†¬† Automotive innovation has moved into an era where intelligence shapes every experience. Vehicles are becoming adaptive platforms that learn, update, and improve throughout their lifecycle. The Snapdragon Digital Chassis provides the foundation of this transformation, strengthened by collaborations with partners like Google, Volkswagen Group, and Hyundai Mobis. The introduction of Snapdragon Chassis Agents adds another layer of capability, enabling automakers to accelerate development timelines while delivering richer, more personalized in-cabin experiences.¬† This evolution isn‚Äôt just about convenience; it‚Äôs about blending consumer-like familiarity with the uncompromising standards of safety and security that drivers expect. From proactive assistance to context-aware infotainment, intelligence is redefining what connected mobility means. The result? Cars that feel intuitive, stay secure, and continuously evolve.¬† Snapdragon powers the next phase of intelligent mobility IoT expands into an intelligent edge¬† IoT is shifting to a unified, AI-driven edge ecosystem. Qualcomm unveiled an expanded portfolio of Dragonwing Q-Series processors, developer tools, and services‚Äîstrengthened by acquisitions like Augentix, Arduino, Edge Impulse, Focus.AI, and Foundries.io.¬† The¬†Dragonwing Q-8750 delivers 77 TOPS for drones, media hubs, and vision systems, while the Dragonwing Q-7790 brings 24 TOPS to smart cameras and AI TVs, combining high-performance inference with robust security. These platforms enable real-time AI without cloud dependency.¬† Additionally, the acquisition of Augentix enhances imaging for smart cameras and industrial vision systems, while the Qualcomm Insight Platform turns video streams into actionable intelligence for security and operations.¬†Developer accessibility is further expanded through Edge Impulse integration on the Dragonwing AI On-Prem Appliance, enabling secure, offline inference and training for models up to 120 billion parameters.¬†¬† Bottom line: IoT now goes beyond connectivity, encompassing intelligent, secure systems that learn and adapt at the edge. ¬† The cross‚Äëshow meta‚Äëtrend: AI everywhere¬† CES 2026 confirmed what Qualcomm has been signaling for some time now: artificial intelligence isn‚Äôt a feature anymore‚Äîit‚Äôs the foundation. For years, we‚Äôve integrated AI across PCs, vehicles, IoT, and robotics so users can experience real benefits today and for the long term. AI is now embedded across every category, but the real story is the shift from demos to deployable solutions. ¬† For Qualcomm, this trend validates a strategy built on performance, efficiency, and scalability. Our expanded portfolio underscores a commitment to making intelligence practical, secure, and accessible across devices and industries.¬†¬†¬† AI is everywhere, but success now depends on execution‚Äîand Qualcomm is already leading that charge.¬† Thank you for following Qualcomm Vision's coverage during CES 2026. Your passion and curiosity drive the conversations that shape the future of technology. Stay tuned for more insights and stories as we continue to explore how innovation‚Äîfrom AI and connectivity to mobility, IoT, and immersive experiences‚Äîis transforming industries and redefining what‚Äôs possible across the entire tech landscape.¬† ¬†
Keep reading on LinkedIn

subject: CES 2026: Day 3 Recap
content:
Qualcomm Vision

By Qualcomm


By Qualcomm

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ces-2026-day-3-recap-qualcomm-v486c?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BM4cE2PasR0WlXaHAWXj%2BSg%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=3Txul5m0L2CI41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-kzybj4~mk643tdw~5n-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk643tdw-5n&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGUwYmQ4ZWM4ZDk0Njk5YTY4ODY4N2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NjNjYmU1ZjA3MGEzYTliOGNkZTFiNDFjNTgwMWJhYmNhNmRmYTJkOTU2YjljNTFmLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
CES 2026 has been a defining moment for Qualcomm‚Äôs automotive ambitions, spotlighting a bold leap forward in intelligent mobility. This year‚Äôs event saw Qualcomm unveil a robust portfolio of automotive platforms and strategic partnerships, all designed to scale AI, edge computing, and connectivity across the entire vehicle ecosystem.¬† The move toward AI-defined vehicles and intelligent mobility is transforming cars from static machines into dynamic, connected platforms‚Äîcapable of learning, anticipating needs, and interacting seamlessly with drivers and the world around them. Through Snapdragon Digital Chassis solutions (that now power over 400 million vehicles worldwide) we‚Äôre opening doors for new business models, enhanced safety standards, and richer user experiences, while accelerating the pace of innovation across the automotive landscape.¬† Snapdragon Digital Chassis Next-generation automotive innovations¬† Expanded partnership with Google: Snapdragon Digital Chassis and Google‚Äôs automotive software have come together to provide a secure, scalable, end-to-end foundation for next-generation in-car experiences. Building on early milestones such as Android Automotive OS and ‚ÄúGoogle built‚Äëin,‚Äù the expanded effort introduces a unified reference platform aligned to Android Automotive (AAOS) roadmaps (starting with Android 17), cloud‚Äëbased development using Snapdragon virtual SoCs on Google Cloud‚Äôs Axion bare‚Äëmetal instances and streamlined lifecycle management via Project Treble across multiple Snapdragon Cockpit generations. Together, these capabilities enable faster development, lower integration cost, and predictable long‚Äëterm Android updates‚Äîwhile unlocking real‚Äëtime personalization, proactive assistance, multimodal interfaces, and device‚Äëto‚Äëcloud orchestration of generative and agentic AI. Driving the future with Volkswagen: We announced an intended agreement with Volkswagen that puts Qualcomm as the primary supplier of high-performance system-on-chips (SoCs) for the launch of its zonal software-defined vehicle architecture, developed in partnership with Rivian, starting in 2027. This collaboration also brings together expertise from CARIAD and Bosch, aiming to speed up the rollout of highly automated driving features across Volkswagen‚Äôs global lineup. By adopting Snapdragon Digital Chassis, Volkswagen vehicles will offer richer infotainment (leveraging Snapdragon Cockpit Platform capabilities), smarter driver assistance, and effortless updates delivered wirelessly, helping every model stay current and competitive. The combined efforts of these industry leaders are paving the way for faster innovation, easier integration, and a strong foundation for intelligent, personalized, and safe driving experiences, setting a new benchmark for what drivers can expect from modern mobility.¬† ZF and Qualcomm unite to deliver next-gen ADAS platform: Also announced was a collaboration with ZF that introduces a new platform for advanced driver assistance, a new solution designed to give carmakers the flexibility to add a wide range of safety and automation features to different types of vehicles, whether it‚Äôs basic driver support or more sophisticated hands-off capabilities. The system‚Äôs open design makes it easy to incorporate third-party software, while a robust set of development tools helps manufacturers quickly test and roll out new ADAS and infotainment options. By combining powerful AI, real-time perception, and modular hardware, ZF and Qualcomm are helping the automotive industry move toward smarter, safer, and more adaptable vehicles that can keep up with changing technology and consumer expectations.¬†¬† Qualcomm and Hyundai join forces to advance smart mobility: Hyundai Mobis is integrating the Snapdragon Ride Flex SoC and Hyundai Mobis‚Äôs advanced software and sensors. The partnership delivers a unified platform for infotainment and advanced driver assistance. This solution enables automakers to offer safer, smarter, and more efficient software-defined vehicles, supporting both cockpit and automated driving features on a single chip.¬† Leapmotor‚Äôs flagship D19 debuts dual-chipset vehicle architecture: Leapmotor and Qualcomm debuted a breakthrough dual-chipset automotive central computer at CES 2026, integrating Snapdragon Cockpit Elite and Ride Elite platforms. This innovation unifies cockpit, driver assistance, and body controls into a single, high-performance system, powering Leapmotor‚Äôs flagship D19. The controller supports advanced AI, up to eight displays, immersive audio, and seamless connectivity, while enabling real-time coordination and over-the-air updates. With robust sensor integration and scalable architecture, automakers can deliver smarter, safer, and more connected driving experiences. More vehicle connectivity and safety with Qualcomm A10 5G Platform and V2X technology: Also launched was the Qualcomm A10 5G Modem-RF, its first 5G RedCap solution for automotive. This platform delivers fast, reliable connectivity and advanced features across more vehicle models, supporting both LTE and 5G networks for mission-critical services. By integrating Release 17 capabilities and a streamlined design, automakers can accelerate the shift to 5G and enhance safety, convenience, and performance.¬† Additionally, the recent acquisition of Edge Impulse brings powerful edge AI to telematics, enabling features like audio-based crash detection and predictive maintenance. Qualcomm‚Äôs commitment to safety extends to vehicle-to-everything (V2X) technology, enabling direct communication between vehicles and infrastructure. With Autotalks, Qualcomm‚Äôs V2X solutions help prevent accidents and improve traffic efficiency.¬† By combining cellular and V2X connectivity, Qualcomm empowers automakers to deliver smarter, safer, and more connected vehicles for everyone on the road. Read more about how we‚Äôre transforming auto connectivity. ¬† ¬† Snapdragon powers the future of AI-defined vehicles¬† AI-defined vehicles are poised to become one of the most transformative trends in the automotive industry over the coming years. In the context of CES, we‚Äôve seen this vision come to life through groundbreaking announcements that showcase how intelligence at the edge is redefining mobility‚Äîfrom advanced driver assistance to fully immersive, personalized in-vehicle experiences. ¬† Now, we‚Äôre taking the next step with the introduction of Snapdragon Chassis Agents. Building on the established Snapdragon Digital Chassis portfolio, we‚Äôre combining on-edge AI inference with agentic frameworks, enabling software entities to autonomously manage and personalize vehicle functions in real time. ¬† ¬† This compound AI approach allows vehicles to interpret sensor data and passenger preferences, transforming every interaction into actionable insights and creating a safer, more immersive driving experience for everyone on board. ¬† Read this OnQ blog post for details on this new agentic AI architecture. From cloud to car: MulticoreWare highlights seamless ADAS optimization¬† During CES, MulticoreWare introduced a demo showcasing how ADAS workloads can run seamlessly using Qualcomm AI toolchains and Cloud AI 100 instances. The demonstration delivers a complete Cloud-to-Car workflow, enabling OEMs and Tier-1 suppliers to test and optimize Perception, Planning, and Sensor Fusion in the cloud before deploying to the edge.¬† By leveraging Qualcomm AI Hub and the AI Model Efficiency Toolkit (AIMET), MulticoreWare converted a complex, heavy ADAS Perception model to a lighter version, validating its inference on the Qualcomm Cloud AI 100 accelerator‚Äîreplicating automotive-grade performance and reducing development cycles for software-defined vehicles.¬† Garmin launches Nexus Platform powered by Snapdragon Elite for next-gen vehicles¬† Garmin announced the Nexus High-Performance Compute platform, developed in collaboration with Qualcomm and powered by Snapdragon Elite automotive platforms. Nexus brings together essential vehicle systems‚Äîsuch as infotainment, instrument clusters, and advanced driver assistance‚Äîwithin a single, streamlined architecture. Plus, featuring innovative liquid-cooling and delivering up to six times the computing power of previous solutions, Nexus offers flexible integration with support for both single and dual SoC configurations.¬† The platform enables automakers to deliver smarter, safer, and more personalized in-car experiences, while Garmin‚Äôs expertise in hardware and user experience ensures reliability and seamless operation. This partnership marks a significant step forward in bringing scalable, intelligent solutions to the next generation of connected vehicles.¬† ‚ÄúWe are excited to deepen our collaboration with Garmin, combining our Snapdragon Elite automotive platforms with Garmin‚Äôs automotive expertise to transform the in-vehicle experience. These next-generation solutions deliver automakers unparalleled in-vehicle experiences, generative AI-driven personalization, and advanced driver awareness capabilities ‚Äî setting a new benchmark for software-defined vehicle architecture that prioritizes safety and intelligence‚Äù, mentioned Nakul Duggal, EVP, Group General Manager, Automotive, Industrial and Embedded IoT, and Robotics.¬† BMW iX3 with Snapdragon Ride Pilot Qualcomm executives win in MotorTrend‚Äôs 2026 SDV Innovator Awards¬† Qualcomm‚Äôs Ahmed Sadek, VP of Engineering and Laxmi Rayapudi, VP & GM, Software, Auto & IE-IoT were recognized in the MotorTrend‚Äôs 2026 SDV Innovator Awards. ¬† Ahmed was honored in the Expert category for his work in autonomous driving and AI, including leading Qualcomm‚Äôs partnership with BMW on advanced driver assistance systems‚Äîmost notably featured in the new BMW iX3, while Laxmi won in the Leader category for his vision and direction for cockpit and ADAS solutions, driving expansion into the two-wheeler segment with advanced rider assistance and tailored infotainment experiences. Laxmi also leads recent initiatives with Google Cloud, bringing Gemini-powered AI agents to the Snapdragon Digital Chassis.¬† Ahmed Sadek, VP of Engineering Laxmi Rayapudi, VP & GM, Software, Auto & IE-IoT Executive corner During the Future of Computing: Shaping the Next Era of AI PCs panel, Kedar Kondap, SVP & GM, Compute and Gaming, shared a story that highlighted what seamless, cross-device intelligence looks like in practice:¬† ‚ÄúThink about the breadth of Qualcomm‚Äîfrom phones to PCs, tablets, wearables, smart speakers, automotive, robotics....It‚Äôs important that applications work seamlessly across the edge and AI world. We want context flowing from your phone to your PC and beyond. ¬† ‚ÄúSomeone told me this story: their 10‚Äëyear‚Äëold daughter wrote a five‚Äëpage novel on her phone and asked, ‚ÄòDad, can I convert this to a video?‚Äô They did, using a model. She wrote it on the phone; the dad moved it to the PC; the system kept full context and automatically generated a video illustrating the story. That‚Äôs the kind of seamless, cross‚Äëdevice experience we‚Äôre aiming for. At Qualcomm, it‚Äôs important for us to enable that seamless context across devices.‚Äù¬† Kedar Kondap, SVP & GM, Compute and Gaming at Qualcomm (middle) Thank you for joining us for the Day 3 recap of Qualcomm Vision: CES 2026 Edition. Don‚Äôt miss the full CES summary coming this Friday with the biggest trends out of this week in Las Vegas.¬†¬†¬†
Keep reading on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ces-2026-day-3-recap-qualcomm-v486c?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BM4cE2PasR0WlXaHAWXj%2BSg%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=3Txul5m0L2CI41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-kzybj4~mk643tdw~5n-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk643tdw-5n&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGUwYmQ4ZWM4ZDk0Njk5YTY4ODY4N2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NjNjYmU1ZjA3MGEzYTliOGNkZTFiNDFjNTgwMWJhYmNhNmRmYTJkOTU2YjljNTFmLDEsMQ%3D%3D

subject: remainder
content:
Dear Team,

Greetings.

I am pleased to introduce myself as your mentor, Viswanth Prayaga, an
experienced Data Scientist.
Welcome to the Infosys Internship Program, and congratulations on being
selected.
I look forward to working closely with you as we begin our journey on the
project.

Kick-off Session
Our first virtual meeting is scheduled as follows:

Project Name: " Building an Ambient Agent with LangGraph for an Email
Assistant "

Time: 6:00 -7:00 PM
Meeting Link: https://meet.google.com/rya-sqgp-ogi
(mention the same link throughout the internship - if any changes, we will
notify you)

Program Structure and Expectations
Please take note of the following important points:
1. From DATE onwards, we will have daily sessions within the same time
window. The exact timings can be discussed and finalized during the initial
session, keeping everyone‚Äôs feasibility in mind.
2. These sessions are not classroom-style lectures. They are intended for
collaboration, guidance, and hands-on problem-solving, so there is no
expectation of formal lectures.
3. The first few sessions will focus on:
3.1. Introductions and alignment
3.2. Understanding project objectives and deliverables
3.3. Identifying any knowledge gaps
3.4. Setting clear expectations for the internship
4. Attendance and Communication
4.1. If you need to take leave at any point, please inform me in advance so
that LEAVE can be marked in the attendance register. Otherwise, ABSENT will
be recorded.
4.2. For all official communication, please use email only to ensure
clarity and proper documentation.
5. Professional Conduct
5.1 All interactions are expected to maintain a high standard of
professional decorum at all times.
5.2. Respect for peers, mentor guidance, and the overall program structure
is mandatory.

We hope this internship will help you develop strong problem-solving
instincts and practical skills in data science through real-world project
exposure.

I look forward to meeting all of you and starting this collaboration.

Warm regards,
Viswanth Prayaga
Mentor ‚Äì Infosys Internship Program

subject: CES 2026: Day 2 Recap
content:
Qualcomm Vision

By Qualcomm


By Qualcomm

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ces-2026-day-2-recap-qualcomm-tbltc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BiluXyOTMR6WeqdTstnaFKA%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=2oyoX3_BsCBs41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-kzybj4~mk4op6lv~6q-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk4op6lv-6q&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGUwYmM4Y2NlZDc0NzkwYTg4YTZlN2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NzBiNmRjZGI0NWIyZGViOWY3ZjA5YmUyOGY5ZmIxZjAyZWZjZjk4MGEzMWVkYzNjLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
Robotics took center stage at CES 2026, as Qualcomm showcased its most ambitious leap yet in intelligent machines. The spotlight was on a new full-stack robotics system and the unveiling of the Qualcomm Dragonwing IQ10 processor‚Äîdesigned to power everything from advanced humanoids to industrial autonomous robots. This year‚Äôs event marked a pivotal moment, with Qualcomm demonstrating how its expertise in energy-efficient, high-performance systems is now driving the evolution of robotics from concept to deployment. By integrating hardware, software, and advanced AI, Qualcomm is enabling robots to learn, adapt, and operate in real-world environments‚Äîsetting a new pace for innovation across industries.¬† Also unveiled were two new Qualcomm Dragonwing Q-series processors‚Äîthe Q-7790 and Q-8750‚Äîeach distinguished by advanced on-device AI capabilities, immersive multimedia experiences, and strong security features. ¬† Qualcomm Dragonwing IoT Ecosystem At-a-glance: Qualcomm Dragonwing Q-Series Processors¬† Dragonwing Q-8750¬† Qualcomm‚Äôs most advanced IoT processor to date¬† 77 TOPS AI engine with support for INT4/8/16 and FP16 precision¬† Enables real-time inference and on-device large language models up to 11 billion parameters‚Äîno cloud dependency required¬† Advanced camera architecture supports up to 12 physical cameras and triple 48 MP ISPs¬† Ideal for robotics, drones, and multi-angle vision systems¬† Dragonwing Q-7790¬† 24 TOPS of on-device AI performance for advanced inference¬† Designed for smart cameras, AI TVs, and collaboration systems‚Äîfully cloud-independent¬† Multimedia capabilities include dual 4K60 display support, 4K60 encoding, and 4K120 video decoding with AV1 hardware decode for premium picture quality¬† Robust security features: Total Management Engine, Secure Boot, and Qualcomm Trusted Execution Environment¬† Optimized for environments where data integrity and privacy are paramount Advancing the edge: Intelligent performance and seamless integration¬† Purpose-built for immersive and secure edge computing, the Dragonwing Q-7790 enables manufacturers to create advanced devices for both consumer and enterprise markets. This processor combines energy-efficient, high-speed performance with robust security protocols and integrated AI, delivering responsive and intelligent experiences directly at the edge.¬†¬† Its support for multiple displays, high-definition imaging, low-latency audio, and rapid wireless connectivity streamlines development and accelerates product launches. Compatibility with Android and Linux also ensures quick prototyping, simplified maintenance, and extended device lifecycle.¬† On the other hand, the Dragonwing Q-8750 brings powerful video processing and on-device AI to platforms such as enterprise drones, smart TVs, media hubs, action cameras, and collaborative systems. Real-time analytics and multi-camera capabilities allow devices to interpret visual data locally, minimizing dependence on cloud services. With ultra-high-resolution video, swift connectivity, and integrated AI accelerators, the Q-8750 supports advanced functions like motion sensing, facial recognition, adaptive content, and autonomous navigation.¬†¬† Beyond processors¬† Qualcomm‚Äôs commitment to edge intelligence goes beyond processors. The Qualcomm AI On Prem Appliance now brings world-class inference and training capabilities directly to secure, private networks‚Äîsupporting offline operations and efficient management of large AI models. This solution streamlines the entire data pipeline, from synthetic data generation to model optimization, making it ideal for high-security environments.¬† Additionally, the Qualcomm Insight Platform is transforming video intelligence for security and operations teams. By leveraging edge AI and conversational engines, it turns video streams into actionable insights in real time, enabling smarter infrastructure and unified control across industries.¬† Scalable intelligence for real-world robots¬† Setting a new benchmark in robotics innovation, we‚Äôre introducing a complete robotics system architecture that spans from silicon-to-skills. We unveiled the Dragonwing IQ10 processor, the leading and latest addition to premium-tier robotics processors for humanoids and advanced AMRs in our portfolio, designed to accelerate the deployment of intelligent machines‚Äîfrom household robots to full-size humanoids.¬† By drawing on our experience in other industries, we‚Äôre uniquely positioned to enable robotic solutions that combine proven power efficiency, scalability, and advanced AI performance, helping accelerate the roadmap from lab to real-world deployment.¬† Lenovo unveils Snapdragon powered innovation at Sphere¬†¬† Lenovo Tech World took over the Sphere in Las Vegas yesterday during CES, showing off new devices powered by Snapdragon:¬† Lenovo Yoga Slim 7x ‚Äì Consistent Power on the Move: Powered by the Snapdragon X2 Elite processor, the Lenovo Yoga Slim 7x combines strong performance and next-gen efficiency in a slim, lightweight design for creators on the move. It delivers 30W TDP performance, whisper-quiet operation, and multi-day battery life and its 14" OLED PureSight Pro display offers rich color and stunning contrast, while advanced AI capabilities make multitasking and demanding workflows effortless‚Äîplugged in or unplugged.¬† Lenovo Yoga Slim 7x Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 5x and IdeaPad 5x 2-in-1¬†‚Äì The Smarter Choice of Mobility: Both powered by the Snapdragon X2 Plus, the IdeaPad Slim 5x delivers ultra-light portability and sleek style, while the IdeaPad 5x 2-in-1 adapts effortlessly between laptop and tablet modes for maximum versatility. Built to last with a durable metal chassis and upgradable memory and storage, these PCs are ready for anything. With rapid charging and all-day battery life, you‚Äôre free to work, create, and connect‚Äîno desk required.¬† motorola shares latest innovations¬† A first-look at the razr fold, where iconic design meets next gen power: Blending iconic style with cutting-edge Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 power, motorola‚Äôs first foldable will feature a flexible display that adapts to your needs‚Äîopening wide for creative projects and folding down for easy portability. Designed for seamless multitasking, with intelligent AI features to keep you organized and an impressive camera system, this smartphone launch is well anticipated. Stay tuned.¬†¬† motorola razr fold motorola signature, capturing brilliance:¬†The motorola signature harnesses the full power of the Snapdragon 8 Gen 5, delivering top-tier performance for gaming, multitasking, and adaptive on-device AI. With Snapdragon Sound, users enjoy crystal-clear calls and immersive audio, while the advanced camera system enables cinematic 4K video recording, up to 100x zoom, and stunning visuals in any light.¬† motorola signature At CES, motorola set up immersive stations that highlighted the signature‚Äôs camera capabilities‚Äîfrom dramatic periscope zooms over city skylines to effortless portrait modes on the Las Vegas Strip. Each demo revealed how Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 powers smooth stabilization, vivid color, and advanced imaging, transforming mobile photography into an intuitive, editorial-quality experience for creators and professionals.¬†¬† Executive corner¬† As automotive technology evolves, the line between consumer electronics and in-car experiences continues to blur. Mark Granger, VP of Snapdragon Digital Cockpit Product Management at Qualcomm, captured this shift at CES 2026‚Äôs Omdia panel Is the Car of the Future Just Another Consumer Device? with the following insight:¬† ‚ÄúThe expectations are getting higher and higher for the experience inside the car to be very consumer-like, right? So, it's very familiar, you feel comfortable with it, it's second nature, and it knows a bit about you. Now at the same time, it still needs to play by the games of safety, security, and whatnot that you want in your automobile, right? It's really blending the two worlds together.‚Äù¬† Mark Granger, VP of Snapdragon Digital Product Management at Qualcomm During the Lenovo Tech World event, Qualcomm President and CEO Cristiano Amon shared his perspective on the future of AI-powered wearables, highlighting the massive scale and the convergence of technology with personal fashion:¬† ‚ÄúI actually don't think it's unrealistic to think [AI is] going to go into billions of devices. We see the potential to be in 10 to 100 million [devices] in the next couple of years, and it's going to be very big. And what's interesting is the reason we talk about wearables in those personal AI devices, because humans already decided what they're going to wear. And it's going to be glasses, and jewelry, and pendants, and rings, and bracelets, and pins. And this is the opportunity that the tech industry is going to merge with the fashion industry.‚Äù¬† Cristiano Amon, Qualcomm President and CEO, takes the stage at the Lenovo Tech World event Thank you for joining us for the Day 2 recap of Qualcomm Vision: CES 2026 Edition. Be sure to come back tomorrow for more expert insights and announcements. ¬†
Keep reading on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ces-2026-day-2-recap-qualcomm-tbltc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BiluXyOTMR6WeqdTstnaFKA%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=2oyoX3_BsCBs41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-kzybj4~mk4op6lv~6q-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk4op6lv-6q&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGUwYmM4Y2NlZDc0NzkwYTg4YTZlN2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NzBiNmRjZGI0NWIyZGViOWY3ZjA5YmUyOGY5ZmIxZjAyZWZjZjk4MGEzMWVkYzNjLDEsMQ%3D%3D

subject: remainder
content:
Dear Team,

Greetings.

I am pleased to introduce myself as your mentor, Viswanth Prayaga, an
experienced Data Scientist.
Welcome to the Infosys Internship Program, and congratulations on being
selected.
I look forward to working closely with you as we begin our journey on the
project.

Kick-off Session
Our first virtual meeting is scheduled as follows:

Project Name: " Building an Ambient Agent with LangGraph for an Email
Assistant "

Time: 6:00 -7:00 PM
Meeting Link: https://meet.google.com/rya-sqgp-ogi
(mention the same link throughout the internship - if any changes, we will
notify you)

Program Structure and Expectations
Please take note of the following important points:
1. From DATE onwards, we will have daily sessions within the same time
window. The exact timings can be discussed and finalized during the initial
session, keeping everyone‚Äôs feasibility in mind.
2. These sessions are not classroom-style lectures. They are intended for
collaboration, guidance, and hands-on problem-solving, so there is no
expectation of formal lectures.
3. The first few sessions will focus on:
3.1. Introductions and alignment
3.2. Understanding project objectives and deliverables
3.3. Identifying any knowledge gaps
3.4. Setting clear expectations for the internship
4. Attendance and Communication
4.1. If you need to take leave at any point, please inform me in advance so
that LEAVE can be marked in the attendance register. Otherwise, ABSENT will
be recorded.
4.2. For all official communication, please use email only to ensure
clarity and proper documentation.
5. Professional Conduct
5.1 All interactions are expected to maintain a high standard of
professional decorum at all times.
5.2. Respect for peers, mentor guidance, and the overall program structure
is mandatory.

We hope this internship will help you develop strong problem-solving
instincts and practical skills in data science through real-world project
exposure.

I look forward to meeting all of you and starting this collaboration.

Warm regards,
Viswanth Prayaga
Mentor ‚Äì Infosys Internship Program

subject: CES 2026: Day 1 Recap
content:
Qualcomm Vision

By Qualcomm


By Qualcomm

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/ces-2026-day-1-recap-qualcomm-iiamc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BVBwmYMgRSkaVYwGWJPGA2A%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=34OVChuMm2zY41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-kzybj4~mk39829y~s8-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk39829y-s8&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGUwYjM4YmNhZDE0NjljYTY4ZTYzN2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NDdlNGY4ZTc2MGFmYzJiZWRmZjYxNWRiNTA0OGJiN2JlYzg0NzdmZWY0Y2JmNzE3LDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
Snapdragon X2 Plus: The next step in the evolution of Snapdragon X Series PCs CES 2026 kicked off with a major announcement: the debut of Snapdragon X2 Plus, the latest leap forward in intelligent computing. Designed for creators, professionals, and everyday explorers, Snapdragon X2 Plus unleashes experiences that feel effortless, and always in sync with your ambitions, fueled by blazing performance and on-device AI power. Kedar Kondap, Qualcomm SVP & GM of Compute and Gaming, presenting the new Snapdragon X2 Plus At-a-glance: Snapdragon X2 Plus Up to 10-core, 3rd gen Qualcomm Oryon CPU for unmatched efficiency¬†¬† 80 TOPS NPU for agentic AI and multiple concurrent AI apps¬† Multi-day battery life for true unplugged productivity¬† Advanced security with hardware-based protection and remote management¬† Seamless connectivity via Wi-Fi 7, 5G, and Bluetooth¬† Ultra-portable designs that stay cool and quiet under pressure¬† ‚ÄúThe development of Snapdragon X2 Plus has been a journey defined by innovation and a clear vision: to deliver a platform that‚Äôs not just faster, but fundamentally smarter and more responsive,‚Äù said Kedar Kondap, Qualcomm SVP & GM of Compute and Gaming. ‚ÄúUltimately, we were looking to create something that truly adapts to the way people live and work.‚Äù¬† The launch of Snapdragon X2 Plus marks an exciting expansion of the Snapdragon X Series portfolio, building on the momentum from last year‚Äôs Snapdragon Summit. Following the introduction of Snapdragon X2 Elite Extreme and Snapdragon X2 Elite‚Äîthe fastest, most powerful, and efficient processors for Windows PCs‚ÄîSnapdragon X2 Plus brings these leaps in performance, battery life, and AI to even more users. Snapdragon X2 Plus processor AI at the forefront With Snapdragon X2 Plus, and the second-generation Snapdragon X Series overall, the PC industry is entering a new era where the user experience is fundamentally redefined by personal AI. ‚ÄúThe next UI isn‚Äôt just about screens and clicks, it‚Äôs about intelligent agents that center around you, transforming your device into a proactive teammate,‚Äù mentioned Kondap. Powered by Snapdragon‚Äôs on-device AI, PCs can now see, hear, and act on your behalf, delivering private, contextual, and always-on assistance that moves with you and learns from your workflow. From text suggestions and instant meeting summaries to enhanced resolution on images and intelligent image generation that unlock new ways to express creativity, Snapdragon X2 Plus transforms everyday tasks into seamless, intuitive experiences. This shift puts the human at the heart of every interaction, whether you‚Äôre driving productivity in the office, creating on the go, or collaborating across teams. As personal devices become intelligent assistants, Snapdragon is powering a future where your assistant anticipates your needs, adapts to your environment, and elevates your impact‚Äîacross every sector and every moment. Enterprise-grade security, built in Security is also a cornerstone of the Snapdragon X2 Plus platform, delivering advanced protection and control for modern laptops. With the Qualcomm Secure Processing Unit, Microsoft Pluton TPM, and Secured-core PC support, devices powered by Snapdragon X2 Plus are engineered to start secure and stay secure. Features like Windows Hello login, layered Secure Boot, run-time memory encryption, and Trusted Execution Environment safeguard critical processes, while Zero Trust sensors and auto-heal resilience help maintain system integrity. For enterprise and IT teams, Snapdragon Guardian Technology adds optional premium out-of-band management with dedicated hardware and always-on connectivity via 4G, 5G, and Wi-Fi 7, enabling remote location, locking, wiping, and management of devices. This comprehensive approach ensures enterprise-grade security and peace of mind, wherever work happens. Leading OEMs embrace next-gen Snapdragon X Series platforms Top OEMs are quickly adopting the second generation of Snapdragon X Series platforms, including the Snapdragon X2 Plus, bringing its advanced performance and AI features to new PCs across the industry. HP: Announced that their next generation of premium business laptops, the HP EliteBook X G2 Series, will feature a Snapdragon X2 Elite variant and Snapdragon X2 Plus processors. This means top-tier AI performance with up to 85 TOPS NPU.¬†¬† HP EliteBook X G2q HP is also introducing a refreshed OmniBook lineup, engineered to maximize the latest Snapdragon technology. Across the portfolio, users can choose from a range of sizes and processors across Snapdragon X Series: OmniBook Ultra: Combines unmatched AI performance and premium design, powered by a Snapdragon X2 Elite variant for up to 38 hours of battery life and next-level productivity.¬†¬† OmniBook 5 Refresh / Omnibook X Series: Designed for users on the move, this series offers responsive AI-driven performance, lifelike OLED visuals, and up to 34 hours of battery life.¬†¬† OmniBook 3 Series: Versatile and built for working on-the-go, supporting up to 45 hours of battery life thanks to Snapdragon X processors.¬† ASUS: Announced an expansion of its portfolio of Snapdragon powered PCs. The new lineup includes the ProArt PZ14, Vivobook S16 and Zenbook A14 ‚Äî all featuring the Snapdragon X2 Elite ‚Äî and the Zenbook A16 equipped with powerhouse Snapdragon X2 Elite Extreme. In addition, the ASUS AiO VM441QA introduces a new form factor powered by Snapdragon X. ASUS Zenbook A16 Executive corner Qualcomm leadership has been active during CES 2026. Here are some of the highlights: Cristiano Amon, President and CEO, made a surprise guest appearance during the opening ceremonies where he shared his thoughts on the impact of AI becoming more context-aware and how it transforms our relationship with devices and computing. ‚ÄúWhen we think about the evolution of mobile devices‚Äîwhere the things we wear, whether watches, glasses, pendants, or jewelry, all become smart and allow us to connect to agents‚Äîwe‚Äôre starting to see how computing and the entire consumer electronics industry are changing. Computers now understand what we see and what we say; they understand our world. "As AI gets produced and it goes into all of the devices where humans are, we are seeing this massive transformation happening with consumer electronics‚Ä¶ this new category of personal AI devices is going to be massive, it‚Äôs going to be as big as phones, and we‚Äôre just at the beginning of that.‚Äù Cristiano Amon, Qualcomm President and CEO, at the opening ceremony of CES 2026 Nakul Duggal, EVP, Group GM, Automotive, Industrial and Embedded IoT, and Robotics joined the McKinsey Panel: Transforming Industries with Physical AI yesterday to discuss how robotics can play a major role in the acceleration of automation: ‚ÄúOver the past decade, the industry has invested enormous energy into physical AI‚Äîself-driving cars, automated driving, and the ability to solve real-world problems that actually make an impact. What we‚Äôve learned is that achieving this requires tremendous scale. Robotics, to me, is taking that to the next inflection point in this process. "There isn't, really, on the X/Y axis, any limit to what you're trying to automate. That‚Äôs why this space is so exciting and why I agree and believe it‚Äôs going to move quickly.‚Äù Nakul Duggal, EVP, Group GM, Automotive, Industrial, and Embedded IoT, and Robotics (right) On the Blueprint of Innovation Panel: The Tech Shaping Tomorrow, Ignacio Contreras, VP of Product Marketing at Qualcomm, shared his vision for the potential of AI in transforming products and experiences everywhere: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre now a quarter into the 21st century and it‚Äôs now coming into focus what are the biggest innovations shaping society. From my perspective, there‚Äôs at least two that that have made an impact on a global scale: One is the smartphone‚Ä¶ and the second one is artificial intelligence. "Those two are, clearly, not only major technological breakthroughs, but really inventions that change the course of society." Ignacio Contreras, VP of Product Marketing at Qualcomm (right) Thank you for joining us for the Day 1 recap of Qualcomm Vision: CES 2026 Edition. The innovation is just getting started‚Äîbe sure to come back tomorrow for our Day 2 recap, where we‚Äôll dive deeper into the latest announcements, news, and industry insights from the show floor.

subject: The latest AI news we announced in December
content:
The Monthly AI Recap

By Google


By Google

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/latest-ai-news-we-announced-december-google-huzie?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BqGD1IFaISWaU0Kro4clWgA%3D%3D&midToken=AQGFZdoIPy4nLw&midSig=18fh7yO5OYzI41&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-kzybj4~mk31v7yb~m5-null-null&eid=kzybj4-mk31v7yb-m5&otpToken=MTMwNzE4ZTkxNTJmYzhjN2I2MjYwZmViNDExOGUwYjM4Y2NjZDI0NjliYTY4YzZkN2JjZjA5NmM0YzU4NTRmYmY2ZDNkNWU5NDZlZWQwODI1MjkyYWM4NGYwNGMzYTkzZjUwNjdiZGQxYWRhMDQ5ZTNhYjQzMGVlLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
Want to keep up with all the AI news coming out of Google? We've got you covered. This new monthly digest breaks down the most important updates and insights, all in one place. Hit the subscribe button to follow along! December is usually a time for reflection, and looking ahead. That‚Äôs one reason why we've been focused on taking frontier intelligence out of the lab and putting it into your hands in ways that actually matter for your day-to-day. Whether it‚Äôs the lightning speed of Gemini 3 Flash helping you tackle tasks in seconds, the new video verification tools in the Gemini app or the simple relief of having GenTabs tame your open tabs, these updates share a single goal: making technology adapt to you, not the other way around. And as we push these boundaries, we‚Äôre staying grounded in responsibility ‚Äî launching new tools to help you verify AI content so you can explore this new frontier with confidence. We released Gemini 3 Flash, featuring frontier intelligence built for speed. Gemini 3 Flash brings frontier intelligence to virtually every corner of the Google ecosystem, combining the speed of our most advanced models with improved reasoning capabilities to help with everyday tasks, all while keeping costs significantly lower. It's rolling out as the default model in the Gemini app and AI Mode in Search so people everywhere can now experience the incredible reasoning of our frontier model, right in our consumer products. And we‚Äôve scaled this rollout to a global community, including developers building in the API Antigravity, our new agentic development platform, and enterprise customers on Vertex AI.We added new AI verification tools for videos in the Gemini app. We‚Äôre bringing video verification capabilities directly to the Gemini app. People can now upload videos ‚Äî up to 100 MB or 90 seconds ‚Äî and simply ask if the content was generated or edited using Google AI. Gemini uses imperceptible SynthID watermarks to analyze both audio and visual tracks, pinpointing exactly which segments contain AI-generated elements. We added new AI verification tools for videos in the Gemini app. We‚Äôre bringing video verification capabilities directly to the Gemini app. People can now upload videos ‚Äî up to 100 MB or 90 seconds ‚Äî and simply ask if the content was generated or edited using Google AI. Gemini uses imperceptible SynthID watermarks to analyze both audio and visual tracks, pinpointing exactly which segments contain AI-generated elements. We announced a new experiment to improve browsing and manage complex online tasks. We‚Äôve all felt the friction of juggling dozens of tabs to research a topic or plan a trip. Enter Disco, a new browsing experience from Google Labs designed to tame that complexity. Disco features GenTabs, an experiment that proactively synthesizes your open tabs and chat history to build custom, interactive web applications ‚Äî transforming a scattered browser session into a streamlined tool for getting things done. We upgraded Gemini audio models for powerful voice interactions. The updated Gemini 2.5 Flash Native Audio is built to handle complex workflows and natural dialogue ‚Äî meaning smoother conversations, higher accuracy and better responsiveness to instructions. It‚Äôs available now in AI Studio, Vertex AI, Gemini Live and, for the first time, Search Live. Plus, a new live speech translation beta in the Google Translate app brings live translation in 70+ languages directly to your headphones, preserving original intonation and pacing to unlock truly global communication. We released a new Gemini Deep Research agent. We brought a more powerful Gemini Deep Research to developers through the Interactions API. Developers can now embed advanced research capabilities ‚Äî like navigating complex topics and synthesizing findings ‚Äî directly into their own applications using a Gemini API key from Google AI Studio. We‚Äôve also open-sourced our new DeepSearchQA benchmark, offering a transparent way to test just how comprehensive and effective research agents can be on web tasks. Plus, we shared how developers are already building mobile-first solutions to address real-world problems, from AI assistants for the visually impaired to tools fostering autonomy for people with cognitive disabilities. We released a new way for shoppers in the U.S. to use our virtual try-on tool. U.S. shoppers now have a more personalized way to find their next favorite outfit with our updated virtual try-on tool. Instead of needing a full-body photo, you can now upload a simple selfie and Nano Banana will generate a realistic, full-body digital version of you. Once you‚Äôve selected your preferred studio-like image and clothing size, you can instantly see how you‚Äôd look in billions of products from our Shopping Graph. We expanded Gemini 3 Pro and Nano Banana Pro in Search. We brought our most intelligent model, Gemini 3, to AI Mode in Google Search in nearly 120 countries and territories in English. Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers can visualize complex topics with Gemini 3 Pro by tapping ‚ÄúThinking with 3 Pro‚Äù in the model drop-down in AI Mode. We also brought our generative imagery model, Nano Banana Pro, to AI Mode in more countries in English, starting with Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. For those in the U.S., we also expanded access to these Pro models (no subscription required), with higher usage limits for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. We released the top YouTube trends of 2025 and first-ever personal Recap. YouTube celebrated its 20th birthday by looking back at 2025. MrBeast was the top creator for the sixth year running, while Ros√© and Bruno Mars‚Äô track "APT." became the fastest KPop video to hit one billion views. To mark the occasion, YouTube is launching its first-ever Recap so you can see a personalized summary of your year. We added new ways for you to personalize, create and share your Google Photos Recap. Google Photos Recap has returned to help you celebrate your favorite moments from 2025, now with more features to make the experience truly yours. We‚Äôve added new controls that let you hide specific people or photos, ensuring your trip down memory lane is exactly how you want it. Plus, you can now get creative with exclusive templates in CapCut and easily share your finished masterpiece directly to WhatsApp or your favorite social feeds. We released Year in Search 2025. 2025 delivered history-making headlines ‚Äî from the first American Pope to the global obsession with "KPop Demon Hunters" ‚Äî but the quietest revolution happened right at our fingertips. Thanks to AI, this was the year we saw a massive shift toward natural, conversational questions with a surge in queries like ‚ÄúHow do I‚Ä¶‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the deal with‚Ä¶‚Äù as AI helped technology finally catch up to the way we think.
Keep reading on LinkedIn
